Claims From Claimants Whom VA Has Determined Are Incompetent
VA must process claims it receives from a claimant whom VA has determined is incompetent, even if VA has appointed the claimant a fiduciary.
A VA determination of incompetency under
38 CFR 3.353
constitutes a decision regarding the claimant’s ability to manage their own affairs, including disbursement of funds.  It does
not
preclude such a claimant from prosecuting a claim for benefits.
Reference
:  For more information on the process for determining whether a beneficiary is competent, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.A.3
.
